A.title: Operations Chaos
A.subtitle: SYSTEMS & PROCESS BREAKDOWN
A.description: Your team is working hard, but work keeps falling through the cracks. Without proper systems, every project feels like reinventing the wheel — and your best people are burning out managing chaos instead of doing great work.
insights: Missed deadlines are costing you client trust and revenue
Your team wastes hours every week on preventable confusion
Meeting action items disappear into the void
Client onboarding is inconsistent and stressful

B.title: Revenue Leakage
B.subtitle: SALES & CASH FLOW GAPS
B.description: You're generating opportunities, but money is slipping through the cracks. Slow proposals let hot leads go cold, inconsistent follow-up kills deals, and unpaid invoices strangle your cash flow.
insights: Proposals take too long — leads lose interest and go elsewhere
Deals die because follow-ups don't happen consistently
Unpaid invoices are eating into your working capital
You're leaving money on the table every single month

C.title: Client Retention Risk
C.subtitle: RELATIONSHIP & VALUE GAPS
C.description: Your clients don't fully see the value you deliver. Without proactive communication and clear reporting, they question whether you're worth it — and you're missing out on reviews and referrals that could fuel growth.
insights: Clients ask 'what did we accomplish?' — they don't see your impact
You rarely get reviews or testimonials without begging
Communication is reactive — you're always putting out fires
Referrals are rare because clients aren't actively delighted

Q1A.small: At your size, every dropped ball is visible — and fixable with the right systems.
Q1A.medium: Mid-size teams face the most chaos — too big for informal, too small for enterprise tools.
Q1A.large: At scale, operations chaos compounds fast — small fixes create massive ROI.

Q2A.none: Starting fresh means you can implement the right systems without legacy baggage.
Q2A.basic: Your tools are fine — you need better processes and automation connecting them.
Q2A.advanced: You have the tools — now you need workflows that actually work for your team.

Q3A.meetings: Meeting-to-task automation will instantly capture and assign action items.
Q3A.onboarding: Client onboarding automation ensures consistency and a great first impression.
Q3A.handoffs: Task handoff systems eliminate the 'I thought you were handling that' moments.

Q1B.small: At your size, one or two lost deals a month is a huge percentage of revenue.
Q1B.medium: Mid-size companies lose the most to slow processes — you need speed and consistency.
Q1B.large: At scale, even small improvements in close rate mean massive revenue gains.

Q2B.manual: Manual proposals are killing your speed — automation can cut turnaround by 80%.
Q2B.basic_crm: Your CRM has data — now you need automation to act on it consistently.
Q2B.proposal_software: You have tools but need better workflows to actually speed things up.

Q3B.slow_proposals: AI proposal generation can turn days into hours — before leads go cold.
Q3B.no_followup: Automated follow-up sequences ensure no deal dies from neglect.
Q3B.unpaid_invoices: Invoice reminders and tracking automate your collections process.

Q1C.small: At your size, losing even one client hurts — retention is everything.
Q1C.medium: Mid-size companies often outgrow their client communication — proactive systems help.
Q1C.large: At scale, systematic client success is the difference between growth and churn.

Q2C.email_only: Email-only communication leaves clients feeling ignored between touchpoints.
Q2C.basic_tools: Your tools work — but automation can make communication proactive, not reactive.
Q2C.fragmented: Fragmented tools mean nothing talks to each other — clients fall through cracks.

Q3C.no_visibility: Automated client reporting shows your value without you doing extra work.
Q3C.no_reviews: Review request automation gets you testimonials at the perfect moment.
Q3C.reactive: CRM automation keeps you proactive — clients feel cared for, not forgotten.
